general.description:
Claudia is a practising in-house lawyer and senior manager at Frasers Property Australia and is listed in Doyles Leading In-House Property & Real Estate Lawyers - Australia & NZ.

Member of the Law Society of NSW, Governance Institute of Australia and the Institute of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators.

jobs.description:
Claudia manages the legal function for the Residential business nationally.  As a member of the senior management team, Claudia is a key commercial advisor and risk manager for the business. 

The Residential Legal team manages the delivery of legal advice and services to the business throughout the development life-cycle, including acquisition, structuring and partnering, finance, subdivision and titling, planning and delivery, construction, sales and marketing, retail AFLs and leasing, dispute management, regulatory matters and insurance, divestments and restructures.

Claudia's mandate includes assisting the business in product and service innovation, strategic initiatives and internal policy review and development.

Claudia managed the corporate and commercial in house Australasian practice at Laing O'Rourke Australia, including:
* Treasury and Finance - corporate and asset finance 
* Property and project development and finance
* PPP transactions (including sponsor and equity level roles)
* Company secretarial
* Risk and compliance 
* General corporate and commercial
* Construction

Claudia worked on Laing O'Rourke's McLachlan & Ann Street development at Fortitude Valley, Queensland, including the sale of the commercial stratum to a global property fund.  She led each of Laing O'Rourke Australia's corporate refinance transactions from 2010-15 as well as providing continuous transactional support to the Treasury team.  Claudia worked on a number of PPP submissions as in-house counsel for the Laing O'Rourke equity team. 

Claudia secured Board endorsement of key governance initiatives for the Australian Hub and provided Board support to the Investment group.

As a member of the ABAC Board Committee, Claudia led the Australian Hub's implementation of initiatives across the business for Anti-Bribery & Corruption (ABAC) compliance, including developing and delivering a training and audit program.  

As a member of the EPIC (Environment - People - Industry - Community) Panel, Claudia assisted in establishing the 2014-15 corporate charity relationship with the National Indigenous Youth Leadership Academy through the Foundation for Young Australians.

As a natural people manager and team player, Claudia also led the Legal team's Cultural Mission Statement agenda to encourage positive cultural change and improved team efficiency, including facilitating team workshops and working with individual team members to help them achieve their best.
Planning, Infrastructure, Ports.

Claudia was the first professional to join the founder of this boutique infrastructure
      advisory business providing financial and commercial advisory, packaging and
      arranging of project finance and development management, with a focus on social
      
      infrastructure and acting for the public and private sector.
Assisted in bid production for the Biosciences Research Centre PPP (Vic).

As a member of the Structured Property Finance team, Claudia was responsible for legal transaction management, deal structuring and execution.  The team led the presale property securitisation market and clients included the major property developers.  Claudia also provided legal assistance to the wider Property & Construction Finance Group.

Claudia was a lawyer in the Banking & Finance Group working in the areas of corporate
      finance (for lenders and borrowers), aircraft and asset finance, property finance, RMB
      securitisation and capital markets transactions. Claudia also rotated through the
      
      Corporate Advisory and Taxation groups.

jobs.description:
Andrew Bullock is a Managing Director of Adamantem Capital. He is recognized as one
      of Australia’s most experienced corporate lawyers specialising in private equity and
      public market deals and he is also an experienced company director. Andrew was
      previously a partner at Gilbert + Tobin from 2006 to 2017, serving as head of the firm’s
      corporate advisory team and its market-leading private equity practice.  Andrew is also
      
      a current director of Bailador Technology Investments Limited.

Andrew was the head of the Gilbert + Tobin Corporate Advisory team.  He specialised in mergers and acquisitions, fundraisings and complex joint ventures.

His experience includes:

Acting for both Australian and offshore financial sponsors and on their acquisition and divestment programs.  Key clients included Pacific Equity Partners, KKR, Morrison & Co and Palisade.
Acted for a range of clients in the media sector including Network Ten, Channel Nine, Ticketek, Telstra, Nova and Illyria on M&A and fundraisings.
Advised Australian and international corporates on governance issues and strategic joint ventures.
Key transactions included
- The Qube Consortium’s $12 billion acquisition of Asciano
- REA’s $750m acquisition of iProperty by scheme of arrangement
- PEP’s joint bid for Pacific Hydro; acquisitions of Pinnacle Foods, Spotless and Energy Developments and IPOs of Spotless, Link and Veda.
- Channel Ten’s $160m recapitalisation and strategic alliance with Foxtel.
- Sale of PBL Media to CVC.

Andrew's experience includes 3 years in the London office of Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer during which time he acted on a range of M&A transactions, demergers and IPOs.

Andrew is recognised by Chambers Global as a leading lawyer in mergers and acquisitions (including Band 1 for Private Equity) and in 2007 was a finalist in the Australian Dealmaker of the Year category at the Australasian Law Awards.  He has been named in the Australian Best Lawyers list since inception.

general.headline: Senior Associate at Minter Ellison
general.description:
Anna-Maria is a Senior Associate at Minter Ellison practising exclusively in the area of health law. 

Anna-Maria's practice is primarily focused on managing pre-litigated and litigated medical malpractice claims.  Her repertoire includes catastrophic injury claims and matters involving complex liability issues, complex multi-party contribution and apportionment issues, and/or significant quantum, together with secondary claims, including nervous shock, wrongful death, dependency and loss of consortium. 

Anna-Maria has a special interest in health regulation and provides advice and assistance to health practitioners and health services providers in respect of investigations and others matters conducted via the Office of the Health Ombudsman and AHPRA. 

Anna-Maria is experienced in managing coronial investigations and inquests in relation to health care related reportable deaths. Anna-Maria has appeared before the Coroner in several coronial inquests. 

Anna-Maria regularly appears as advocate on behalf of clients at settlement conferences and mediations and has appeared in a variety of jurisdictions in Queensland including the Supreme Court and Magistrates Court of Queensland and QCAT.

Anna-Maria also provides general advisory services to the health care sector, including in relation to incident investigation, complaints management, capacity, consent, guardianship and privacy matters and a range of other issues relevant to the sector.

general.description:
Tamlyn Mills is a Senior Associate at MinterEllison, specialising in dispute resolution.  In her role, Tamlyn assists both private and public sector clients to manage and resolve disputes, utilising a spectrum of dispute resolution techniques including mediation, arbitration and litigation.  As a litigator, Tamlyn has represented clients in proceedings in the Federal Court of Australia, the New South Wales Supreme Court, Queensland Supreme Court and Western Australia Supreme Court.
 
Tamlyn's practice focuses on commercial and corporate disputes and she has advised clients in relation to corporate governance, shareholder disputes and directors' duties.

Tamlyn has a depth of experience in the energy and resources industry and has acted for both junior and established mining companies as well as participants in the National Electricity Market.
 
Tamlyn holds a Master of Laws with Distinction from the London School of Economics and Political Science with a focus on dispute resolution, including international arbitration, alternative dispute resolution, international trade and international disputes.  She is a member of MinterEllison's International Dispute Resolution Group and International Trade Group. 

Tamlyn's dispute resolution practice complements her experience in competition and regulatory law where she has advised clients in relation to restrictive trade practices, access to services, mergers and acquisitions, consumer law, energy regulation and national health regulation.

Cassandra advises on project development, transactions and commercial/corporate matters across the LNG, oil and gas, power, mining and infrastructure sectors. general.headline: Partner at Minter Ellison
general.description:
Gareth is one of Australia’s leading industrial relations and employment law specialists. He has formidable public and private sector experience in litigious, commercial and strategic matters across all aspects of workplace related law. 

Recently, Gareth acted for the Commonwealth Bank in the landmark High Court decision which found implied term of trust and confidence was not part of Australian law - a decision described by a leading academic as "one of the most important employment law decisions this century".  Commonwealth Bank of Australia v Barker [2014] HCA 32.

Chambers Asia Pacific reports Gareth as being 'lauded as a "person you want in the room" for his "amazing technical expertise" and encyclopaedic knowledge of case law' (2015), as "technically the best lawyer I've ever come across" (2016) and as "pragmatic and strategic, a really great lawyer" (2017). 

Gareth’s practice encompasses all industry sectors including banking and finance, construction, government, manufacturing, media, transport and logistics. He deals widely in highly unionised industries as well as highly sensitive  issues at head office and board level.

Gareth’s expertise spans industrial relations strategies and disputes; enterprise bargaining negotiations; prosecutions; dismissals (including executive terminations and associated Corporations Act issues); all employment aspects of major restructures, privatisations, sales and outsourcings; restraint of trade litigation; and occupational health and safety. 

As a litigator, he regularly conducts proceedings before the Fair Work Commission, the Federal Court, Federal Circuit Court, and other courts and tribunals.

Unusually for a lawyer, Gareth has a background in IT and has developed a range of apps in his practice.  Most recently, he obtained his certification in Neota Logic – which is an environment to develop web and mobile based expert systems (which are rule based artificial intelligence apps).

general.headline: Partner, Human Resources and Industrial Relations at Minter Ellison
general.description:
I am an experienced employment, industrial relations, discrimination and safety lawyer, working with public and private employers to effectively manage business critical industrial relations, human resources, discrimination, safety and employment issues in a range of industries including media, education, IT, construction, transport and retail. 

I have an extensive practice in the media and entertainment sector including television, radio, digital media, film and television production and publishing, where my clients include the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC), Bauer Media, Daily Mail Australia, Guardian Australia, Network Ten, the Nine Network, Pacific Magazines and Seven Media.  I advise our media clients on all employment and industrial issues and have a deep understanding of the sector and the changing media landscape. 

I also work extensively in the schools sector, acting for the Association of Independent Schools NSW and a range of individual schools, and have experience across all aspects of education law including employment issues, child protection, parent disputes and discrimination in the provision of education.  

I have particular skills in dealing with highly sensitive discrimination, harassment, bullying and general grievance matters – often involving senior staff and reputation critical issues. I also work with Boards and senior management teams to provide them with the tools to proactively manage these difficult issues. I have undertaken significant training in this area.  I also undertake investigations and cultural audits in relation to sensitive workplace issues. 

Some of my other clients include the Australian Olympic Committee, David Jones, Frasers Property Group, Google, Qantas and Youth Off The Streets.

jobs.companyName: Harvard Club of Australia, Queensland Chapter
jobs.description:
The Harvard Club of Australia (HCA) is a high profile but relatively informal organisation for Harvard Alumni of any nationality. Alumni status is granted to those who have attended a degree or other substantial program at Harvard University of not less than 6 weeks duration. Formed in 1961, the aim was to promote fellowship amongst the alumni of Harvard University and to assist Australians wishing to study there.

Since its founding in 1961, the Club has built strong links with Harvard University, in particular through promoting learned exchange between Harvard and Australia. The club offers a number of scholarships including the Not-For-Profit Fellowship; the Wolfesohn Scholarship for Public Sector Executives and the Roberta Sykes scholarship for Indigenous citizens.

general.headline: Tax Partner at Minter Ellison
general.description:
As a tax specialist, I have more than 35 years' experience helping large businesses and high-wealth individuals manage their tax obligations and risks. 

This ranges from general tax advice, Australian Taxation Office (ATO) reviews and audits through to litigation. I have also represented the ATO in tax appeals before the Federal Court of Australia and the Administrative Appeals Tribunal.

I maintain a strong working relationship with the Australian Taxation Commissioner and the Commissioner’s team — whether acting for or against them in proceedings. This gives me a unique perspective on managing our clients’ relationships with the ATO, and formulating strategies to achieve the best outcome at the earliest opportunity.

jobs.description:
I am partner in the tax team at Minter Ellison and in particular the Tax Controversy practice. 

The team has a wealth of experience in advising large businesses and high wealth individuals in the management of tax issues along the entire tax value chain, from the ATO review and audit to litigation.

The team also represents the ATO in the conduct of tax appeals in the Federal Court and the AAT, in addition to maintaining a strong working relationship and communication with the Commissioner whether acting for or against. This provides the team with a unique insight into how to manage a client's relationship with the ATO, in particular developing the most appropriate strategy to achieve the best outcome at the earliest opportunity.

The team has conducted significant litigation on behalf of the ATO. Most recently, the team conducted the Chevron litigation on behalf of the ATO, which is one of the most significant cases litigated by the ATO. We also represented the Commissioner in the Resource Capital Fund litigation.

The team has a breadth of industry sector knowledge including banking & finance, funds management, pharmaceuticals, manufacturing, automotive, retail, property & construction, mining, information technology & communications, energy, and insurance.

Chris was previously a partner in the Maddocks tax controversy team. 

In FY14 Chris was the Sydney partner in charge of Maddocks.

general.headline: CEO and Partner
general.description:
Michelle leads national law firm Maddocks as their CEO. She assumed the role following 17 years at the firm, some of which directing the firm’s commercial litigation team. Michelle works with the Board and partnership to set and deliver the strategic direction for the firm. 

Michelle is a highly regarded litigation lawyer, having worked in a wide range of disputes with a particular focus on corporations matters (often for directors), competition claims and trusts disputes. She has also acted in a number of disputes involving administrative and constitutional law issues.
Her experience spans both private sector companies, as well as public sector clients, including government departments, state-owned businesses and statutory authorities. Her status as a leading litigation lawyer has been recognised in legal directories such as the Legal 500 and Best Lawyers.

Michelle’s leadership has seen the firm continue to grow and to lead the way on issues such as gender equality and diversity. During her time as CEO, Maddocks has been recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equity Agency (WGEA). Her leadership led Michelle to be named one of the Australian Financial Review’s 100 Women of Influence in 2015.  She is the 2016 recipient of the Victorian Award for Excellence in Women’s Leadership and of the award for Executive of the Year in the 2016 Lawyer's Weekly Women in Law Awards.

Michelle is an ambassador for the WGEA ‘In Your Hands’ initiative for pay equity.  She is a director of Global Sisters Limited, a not for profit providing end to end business development support to women whose circumstances prevent them from accessing mainstream employment. She is also a member of The Nature Conservancy Australia's Advisory Board.

general.headline: Founding Partner at William James
general.description:
Michael specialises in commercial litigation, restructuring and corporate insolvency. He has acted for many of Australia's largest financiers as well as private clients and corporates in that space and is recognised in the Doyles Guide as a recommended lawyer in restructuring and insolvency. 

Michael has particular experience in complex litigious matters involving finance, equity markets, trusts, fund management and corporations matters. 
 
He also has specialist expertise advising large corporates and boards of directors through a restructure and uses his prior experience acting for the major banks to successfully manage the numerous stakeholders involved and to ensure optimal outcomes for his clients are achieved. Michael also represents Receivers, Administrators and Liquidators advising on all aspects of external administrations and the associated litigation and is widely regarded as a genuine specialist in that space. 

Prior to founding William James, Michael was one of the partners in the Banking, Insolvency and Disputes team at an international law firm. Under Brendan and Michael’s leadership, William James has quickly established itself as a serious player having been selected as a finalist at the 2018 Australian Law Awards for Dispute Resolution Team of the Year and the firm is listed as a recommended law firm for insolvency and restructuring in the Doyles Guide. 
 
Our lawyers and our work are of the highest quality. Importantly, we don't try to do everything. We only operate in those areas where we can deliver market leading performance - restructuring, corporate insolvency and commercial litigation. 

We are also fierce in our independence. We choose our engagements carefully to ensure we can always act without fear or favour.
